required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrograde Ejaculation and Sexual Dysfunction in Men With Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: Diabetic men and controls are examined for retrograde ejaculation, and erectile dysfunction is registered with a validated questionaire (International Index of Erectile Function-15). Concentration, total number of sperm and motility is determined in freshly delivered ejaculates and postejaculatory urine. Our hypothetis is that diabetics exhibit significantly higher rate of retrograde ejaculation than healthy controls.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Retrograde ejaculation (a minimum of a total of 1 million sperm in postejaculatory urine)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The examination program for each patient was finished within one day.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The examination program (including a questionaire on erectile dysfunction) for each patient was finished within one day.

study_pop.textblock: Diabetic men and non-diabetic men in Denmark.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men 30-55 years of age
- Men registered in a Diabetic Biobank including 6000 diabetics and 6000 controls
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men who do not understand Danish
